text:
Hey everyone!
At first i thought this seemed like a really simple task, but apparently not.
Is there a simple way on how i can have an action (email, notification, etc) which occurs after "X" Amount of enrollments that happened in a workflow? (like set property to X when 20 contacts enrolled in this workflow etc)

Hi all. I've got a slight issue that I'd need help with. I'm trying to update the name of an existing action but it's not reflecting in the workflow builder.

A bit of context. We're releasing a new updated action which includes some new required fields so I'm not able to update the existing one. Related to this topic here: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C019VT42R8X/p1702999998382629>

My flow was supposed to be:
1. update old action name to now be `{action name} (deprecated)`
2. create a new action called `{action name}`
Having done that, I can now see both actions have the same name and there is no way to differentiate between the two. When doing the PATCH request to update the old action, I get the 200 response and I can see the new name listed in `labels.en.actionName`  JSON response.

I've also tried with different names in case some characters were forbidden, such as `{action name} - deprecated` and `Deprecated {action name}`. Still no visible change.

So, is this a caching issue that will go away in a couple of minutes or something else? Thanks in advance
Should've waited 20 more minutes before posting. Just a caching issue it seems. Everything is visible now as it should be

okay so i found a way  "codeless" even but its not a pretty way, so for anyone who maybe also needs this you can just go with another custom object and then copy and pasting a number which gets reduced from the trigger before to one custom object and then to all the other objects

the not pretty part is you have to associate all objects with this one custom object which may require custom code and you then have to create an automatic association for every new object which will be created which also may need custom code but both of these codes should be very simple i think?

I had this exact problem with something not updating. I spent hours reverting and changing and testing to realize that caching on this was something. I think an entire day of me pulling my hair out. Stopped for dinner and hung out with my son, when I came back it was working and then I was like UMMMMM WHAT THE
glad I'm not the only one :smile: just like in that snickers commercial - you're not you when you're hungry :smile:

Hello, is there a way I can create a workflow on a custom object that is associated to a user. I want to change a property on the user based on a property on the custom object the user is associated to? thanks
HAHAHAHA yeah that was my first time building one of those out and when I got back I was like â€” of course. OF COURSE
This is a viable solution thanks <@U04CC57CMBP> again
user.. as in like a HubSpot user? what are you trying to change on the user?
or do you mean you want to update based upon a contact that is associated with the custom object
